citations.narrative:
**On May 28, 2025, a three-month-old female Nyala calf was found to have gained access into the exclusion containment
area of the enclosure. The female calf was able to access an approximately 8" x 10" opening in the bottom of the fencing
separating the exclusion and field area(s) where the animals are housed. The calf was caught and moved to the catch
pen at the back of the enclosure to be reunited with her dam. The damaged portions of the fencing were repaired with
additional wood reinforcements. Outdoor housing facilities should be maintained in a manner to keep the facilities
structurally sound and in good repair in order to contain and protect the animals from harm.
**Corrections were made prior to the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
**On May 28, 2025, a three-month-old female Nyala calf was found to have gained access into the exclusion containment 
area of the enclosure. The female calf was able to access an approximately 8" x 10" opening in the bottom of the fencing 
separating the exclusion and field area(s) where the animals are housed. The calf was caught and moved to the catch 
pen at the back of the enclosure to be reunited with her dam. The damaged portions of the fencing were repaired with 
additional wood reinforcements. Outdoor housing facilities should be maintained in a manner to keep the facilities 
structurally sound and in good repair in order to contain and protect the animals from harm. 
 
**Corrections were made prior to the inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
